* Represents a task of type deadline
* Requires a input after the input "deadline"
* and a due date of format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm after the input "/by"
/* the due date of the task*/
* Creates a new Deadline task with the given description
* The description and date cannot be an empty string
* @param description is a string that describes the task to be done
* @param by is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm that describes the due date(including time) of the task to be completed
* @throws DukeException in cases when the description of task and description of the date and time is empty
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws DukeException{
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The time and date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Please input the date and time in this format: dd/mm/yyyy hhmm");
* Converts Deadline object into a String to be printed out
return "[D]" + super.toString() + "(by: " + DeadlineFormatDateTime + ")";//super will use the Parent's/base class method instead of the child's/sub class method
* Converts the date and time input format of dd/mm/yyyy HHmm to format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma
* @param dateTime is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
* @return a string of date and time in the format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma
DateTimeFormatter customFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d" + " 'of' MMMM yyyy, h':'mma");
* Adds the ordinal suffix to the day
* @param dateTimeFormat is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
* @return a suffix of type String of either st, nd, rd or th depending on the value of the day
private static Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
* Creates a new Duke that will then read the corresponding filePath to load the content
* @param filePath file path of type String to the text file that stores the content
* This is the function of Duke that will read in input
* from the user and execute the task accordingly depending
* on the command until the user exits the program by inputting "bye"
* The main function which is the entry point of the program
* A custom exception class that deals with exception unique to Duke
* Provides the detail of the exception being thrown
* Represents a task of type event
* Requires a input after the input "event"
* and a due date of format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm after the input "/at"
* Creates a new Event task with the given description
* The description and date cannot be an empty string
* @param description is a string that describes the event happening
* @param at is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm that describes the date and time of the event happening
* @throws DukeException in cases when the description of event and description of the date and time is empty
public Event(String description, String at)throws DukeException{
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The time and date of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Please input the date and time in this format: dd/mm/yyyy hhmm");
* Converts Event object into a String to be printed out
* Converts the date and time input format of dd/mm/yyyy HHmm to format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma
* @param dateTime is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
* @return a string of date and time in the format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma
DateTimeFormatter customFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d" + " 'of' MMMM yyyy, h':'mma");
* Adds the ordinal suffix to the day
* @param dateTimeFormat is a string of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
* @return a suffix of type String of either st, nd, rd or th depending on the value of the day
* Deals with making sense of the user command and saving tasks in the file
/*The number of elements in the array*/
/*Checks whether the user have requested to exit the program*/
/*File path that leads to the text file which contains the content and data of the task list*/
/*File path that creates a temporary text file for removing task and marking tasks as done*/
* Represents a new Parser that takes in command of type String from the user input
* @param command input from the user of type String
* Takes in all the command from the user and executes the corresponding command based on the input from the user
* "deadline" - it will create and add a task of type deadline with task description and due date to the task list
* "event" - it will create and add a task of type event with task description and date of event to the task list
*  "todo" - it will create and add a task of type todo with task description to the task list
*  "find" - it will find the corresponding tasks in the list that contains those keywords and list them out
*  "list" - it will list out the current task list
*  "done" - it will mark the task as done and print out a tick
*  "delete" - it will remove the particular task from the task list
*  "bye" - it will exit the loop and hence, program
*  In the case whereby the input does not match any of those command, it will throw an exception
*  and inform the user that no such command exist
* @param tasks the current ArrayList of tasks
System.out.println("Got it. I have added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Integer.toString(sizeOfArray + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(pathname, true));
System.out.println("Unable to write to file: " + e);
System.out.println("Got it. I have added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Integer.toString(sizeOfArray + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(pathname, true));
System.out.println("Unable to write to file: " + e);
System.out.println("Got it. I have added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Integer.toString(sizeOfArray + 1) + " tasks in the list.");
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(pathname, true));
System.out.println("Unable to write to file: " + e);
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a search cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The task you want to find cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.sizeOfList() + " tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in you list:");
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Unable to read or write file: " + e);
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Converts the date and time input format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma to dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
* @param dateTime is a string of format d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma
* @return a string of date and time in the format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d 'of' MMMM yyyy, h':'mma");
* Checks if user have keyed in "bye" in the input
* @return true if user input "bye" and returns false if there is not such input
* Contains methods that deals with the loading of tasks from the file
/*File path that leads to the text file which contains the content and data of the task list*/
/*Array of string which reads in the content from the text file and stores them in this array, which will then be added to the actual Task List*/
/*Creates a taskList of type Task to add the tasks that are stored in the file*/
* Represents a new Storage that reads in pathname of type String to the text file
* @param pathname file path of type String to the text file that stores the content
* Reads in data from the text file and identify the type of tasks from the text file
* It will then create the Task object accordingly based on its type and add it to the task list
* @return a Task List which contains the tasks from the current text file
* @throws DukeException when there is no such text file
throw new DukeException("File could not be found");
* Represents a Task in the TodoList
* There are three types of tasks: deadline, event and todo
* Creates new Task with the given description
* Sets the status of the task to be false (not done)
* Sets the type base on the description of the task
* @param description description of the task which is of type String and should not be empty
this.description = description; //this.description refers to protected String description , = description (parameter)
* Returns the corresponding tick or cross symbol
* @return tick if isDone is true and a cross if isDone is false
* Converts task object into a string with the status (done or not done) and description of the task to be printed out
* @return a string of the task object with the status and description of the task
* Represents an array of tasks with operations that can
* add or remove tasks from the list
* Creates a new TaskList that is an array of different types of tasks
* @param tasks an ArrayList of type Task
* @param task an ArrayList of type Task
* @param index index of the task to be removed from the task
* Retrieve the index of a certain task
* @return an integer of the index of the task
* Retrieve the number of elements in the array list
* @return an integer of the number of elements in the array list
* Represents a task of type ToDo
* Requires a input after the input "todo"
* Creates a new ToDo task with the given description
* The description cannot be an empty string
* @param description is a string that describes the task to be done
* @throws DukeException in cases when the description of the todo task is empty
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Converts Todo object into a String to be printed out
* Extract out the methods that deals with interactions with the user
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Shows error message whenever an exception is thrown
* @param errorMessage error message of type String
* Test out the Deadline class methods to ensure they are working properly and producing the correct output
/*Date and time of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm*/
* Check whether the toString method produce the correct output after the user input the command in the correct format
try{assertEquals("[D]" + "[\u2718]" + " CG2027 Assignment(by: 9 of September 2019, 11:59PM)", new Deadline("deadline CG2027 Assignment",DateTime).toString());}
* Check whether the DateFormatConversion method produce the correct format of d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma after the user input
try{assertEquals("9 of September 2019, 11:59PM", new Event("deadline CG2027 Assignment",DateTime).EventFormatDateTime);}
* Testing out whether JUnit works through the use of a dummy method
* Test out the Event class methods to ensure they are working properly and producing the correct output
/*Date and time of format dd/mm/yyyy HHmm*/
* Check whether the toString method produce the correct output after the user input the command in the correct format
try{assertEquals("[E]" + "[\u2718]" + " Orbital(at: 30 of August 2019, 7:00PM)", new Event("event Orbital",DateTime).toString());}
* Check whether the DateFormatConversion method produce the correct format of d of MMMM yyyy, h:mma after the user input
try{assertEquals("30 of August 2019, 7:00PM", new Event("event Orbital",DateTime).EventFormatDateTime);}
* Test out the ToDo class methods to ensure they are working properly and producing the correct output
* Check whether the toString method produce the correct output after the user input the command in the correct format
try{assertEquals("[T]" + "[\u2718]" + " GEH assignment", new ToDo("todo GEH assignment").toString());}
